text: A 40-year-old male presented with the complaint of pain swelling over the right elbow but no fever for the past10days with a history of trauma 15 days back. In the past, history of tuberculosis of the elbow treated 10 years back on antituberculosis therapy, antitubercular drugs, and surgery was done and recovered with satisfactory result. On investigation X-ray -pathological fracture of radial head with eccentric ballooned expanded radiolucency margin well circumscribed lesion bone cyst. Surgery aim was to excise diseased part and get good functional recovery. Wide excision of tumor was done via anterolateral approach with injection of phenol at excised tumor site Tumor bone soft tissues was send for biopsy after surgery. Post-operative recovery was satisfactory with good reasonable range of movement of elbow was achieved.
